Cows and Heifers should not be carelessly

32. For very often, or commonly,
the Female kind among all Animals is
far smoother, glossier, softer
and handsomer; one should note this
as well in People, Cats or Dogs.
The horns of Bulls or Oxen should be ringed
with shaggy hair twisting in curls
from the forehead down to the nose.
right-middleThe females, among many animals, are softer and smoother than the males.

33. You should avoid displaying Cows and Heifers
as too rough and shaggy;
their limbs should be gracefully modeled.
Sometimes certain Heifers
Among others (you will notice)
are those who have been fattened in their stalls,
so beautifully muscled with plump flanks
that you would rejoice to look at them
right-middleSome fair young Cows, or Heifers.

34. because of the great beauty of their appearance.
From this and other things in life in general
you may seek and practice.
Yet you must also consider the colors
of Oxen and Cows: red, gray and pale,
how wonderfully mottled they all are,
and that the ears are always the same,
not one a hair different from the other.
right-middleCows and Oxen &c. ears are always colored the same.

35. Take note of this when you see cows
in the green meadow know it to be true.
Yet above all I discourage recklessly
making their heads so shoddily long
as some do when working from life.
If you wish to improve your faculties for good painting,
paint Animals from life, and straightaway
they will enjoy a proper appearance.
right-middleLong heads are undesirable.

div.ab:
36. How will it help you, if I always
advise you to copy from stone or bronze?
Bassano, rich in art, who alone is supreme
in painting Beasts, and whom no one
can better in distinction,
painted his curly Sheep, and shaggy Goats,
his Birds, Fish, Fruits, and materials,
from life, for here is where we must arrive.
